attributes.action: change the current unemployment benefit regulations which deny self-employed people the right to benefit if they have earned more than £2705 in the previous twelve months on the grounds that it is discriminatory against the self-employed
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the 1996 Regulations, self-employed people are denied unemployment benefit if they have earned more than £2705 in the twelve months prior to the claim. No employed person faces such a rule: the rule is unfair and discriminatory. There should be no 'cap' on prior earnings in order to qualify: the claimant's current earnings position should be the only guide, as it is for the employed claimant.
